intro: Adenostyles rhombifolia subsp. platyphylloides, commonly known as the broadleaf adenostyle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its rhomboid-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant thrives in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in chaparral and woodland habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Ericaceae family.
